content: flower key chain crochet pattern by dee s knotz materials stitch abbreviations -4 5mm hook magic_ring- magic_ring -worsted weight cotton yarn chain - chain skip - skip -button key ring beads optional st - st additional sewing needle scissors double_crochet - double_crochet half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet measurements/gauge treble_crochet - treble_crochet slip_stitch - slip_stitch when finished your flower key chain will decrease - decrease measure 3 inches across from petal to petal * * - instructions within asterisks are meant from the top of the chain to the bottom petal to be repeated it measures just under 5 inches to check your gauge and make sure that the hook size/yarn combo will produce the same size chain 8 this should measure approximately 2 inches dee s knotz 2025 © this quick pattern is super customizable you can choose to add a button and a key ring but you can also keep it simple and go without if you are planning to add a key ring you can make a shorter chain instead of the chain 17 mentioned below if you are not adding a key ring i advise you to make the longer chain so that the flower can fit through the loop for when you attach it to your purse water bottle holder etc 1 2 round 1 magic_ring double_crochet 10 11 dcs round 2 *chain 1 half_double_crochet double_crochet 3 treble_crochet half_double_crochet in one st slip_stitch into the next st* repeat 3 more times last petal *half_double_crochet double_crochet 3 treble_crochet half_double_crochet in end of round 1 first petal before slip_stitch one st decrease over next 2 sts chain 17 sl st into same chain where you started fasten_off and weave in ends optionally using either your yarn or a matching colour of thread you can sew a button add a key ring and beads 3 4 before last petal after chain 17 and slip_stitch tip for adding beads you should be able to pinch the loop nice and tight and slide your bead down to the base of the flower alternatively if you have a small crochet hook one that would fit through the hole of your bead slide the bead onto your crochet hook then insert the hook into the loop and gently pull the bead onto the loop dee s knotz 2025 ©
